issue.title: Globals can no longer be tuples of strings

content.raw:
Hmm, I think I was mistaken on both counts.

I got confused because my hack was printing `b'2'` on Python 3 and `2` on Python 2.7, but the `2` is still a string, just didn't get printed with quote marks.
Possible I had accidentally done `'asd',#abunchofstuff` for the other issue, which is equivalent to a tuple, not a single string. Single strings do seem to work fine on Python 3.
content.html:
Hmm, I think I was mistaken on both counts.

I got confused because my hack was printing b'2' on Python 3 and 2 on Python 2.7, but the 2 is still a string, just didn't get printed with quote marks. Possible I had accidentally done 'asd',#abunchofstuff for the other issue, which is equivalent to a tuple, not a single string. Single strings do seem to work fine on Python 3.
